Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: NJLass
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely and the location was both convenient and safe. The front desk was helpful, courteous, polite and knowledgeable. My only suggestion would be to get a room other than the first one in the walk up path which can be noisy when guests are returning. There are numerous places to eat within a short, walking distance - we did not partake of the hotel restaurant. The price we paid for our 3 nights was an unbelievable value for what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: aefb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on a Saturday; check-in very smooth (Mary), Room smallish but very clean & comfortable bed. Breakfast is always very good with a great selection of Buffet foods + a cooked Breakfast to order; the location is first class - all in all, a very pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Curmudgeonly waitresses will rip you to shreds.”
Reviews.Author: Todd D
Reviews.Content: Most people don't read reviews for a hotel based on the restaurant in the hotel. But that's what I'm going to lead off with because of the curmudgeonly "waitresses" at breakfast. Sure, it's a complimentary breakfast. But can you say grumpy? Irritable? Temperamental? Maniacal? That describes the waitresses serving this complimentary breakfast. I went with a few friends recently, and it's "seat-yourself" as you walk in. On one morning, after my friend sat at a nearby table, the curmudgeonly waitress told her, "No, you'll sit here." That is a direct quote. On another morning, who knows, maybe she was overwhelmed by the fact that there were a total of FOUR tables seated, but when another friend of mine was eating his omelette, because the other people at his table were done eating, the waitress went to take his plate. He asked the waitress if she could leave his plate, as he wasn't yet finished, and she simply stated, "No." Maybe they were understaffed the entire week we were there, or maybe they're not paid enough. But I had never seen such a display of outright hostility. The guest rooms are fine, the front desk staff are very nice, and the location is good, but unless you want to be treated with absolute contempt just for eating breakfast, if you stay at the Buswells, do NOT eat at this restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Debra007
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights in March at Buswell's and we were very happy with the location and the hotel. Setup is a little odd - took the elevator up to the second floor and then went down a flight of stairs to get to the rooms, but not difficult unless you have terribly heavy location. The rooms were comfortable, the windows opened and the staff were extremely nice and helpful. They let us leave our big bags while we went out on a tour of the west coast and then helped us naviagate to the airport through the St. Patrick's Day parade. Quick walk to Trinity College, Stephen's Green and Temple Bar area. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: rebecca m
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights in March for business and paid about 86 euro a night including continental breakfast. great location, right off the corner opposite national museum and leinster. took aircoach from airport and got off kildare street then 1 minute walk, the bus stop is directly opposite the hotel, return ticket 14 euro. check in at 1400 and been told the room won't be ready for another 30 minutes, and i should have a walkabout; they said they can keep my luggage and have it in the room when the room is ready, inconvenient but nevermind, i wandered to dawson street and have lunch, still carrying my handbag and laptop and valuable stuffs that i didn't want to leave in reception. went back after lunch and went up to my room, to my pleasant surprise, the room was bigger than usual, with two big windows looking out to molesworth street, plenty of light. the room was clean and smell fresh, have a big safe inside wardrobe big enough to put the laptop in, have flatscreen tv but only 18 channels, have tea coffee making facilities, hairdryer, toiletry was nicely presented with soap shampoo shower gel and body lotion, shower cap. also have trouser press. unfortunately no fridge. internet was free but need to get a new code everyday so that was very inconvenient. the connection was inconsistent, first night it was superfast, then next night it kept cutting off, not good when i was talking on skype; the third night it kept cutting off again then code expired, it was midnight and i was in pyjama, frustrated but couldn't be bother to go to reception and asked for a new code, the connection was crapped anyway. reception and restaurant staff were friendly and personable. room decor was very dated and would do with a freshen up. decor style was more of a conventional one but suit well with the building style. breakfast buffet was bad, not much choice, may add a few more euro to get the irish cooked breakfast but i need to lose weight so sticked to continental healthy option. the bathroom over the sink light was not working, hot water took a while to heat up, need to run the shower for a minute or two before jumping in. the water stopper in wash basin was missing, although there is a black plastic plug provided, small objects such as jewellery or make up item could easily fell into the big dirty hole in the middle of the sink, there was nothing to stop them, so i use the black plastic plug to half plug in just to form a barrier to stop thing dropping into the drain. awkward. bathroom design was also poor, have undefined corner that was no use, yet not enough surface space to put makeup bag or even hooks to hang towel near the shower. providing some sort of shelf in the empty awkward corner next to wash basin would do the trick, i had to put my makeup bag on the flush tank over toilet, disgusting. acoustic was poor, could hear alarm gone off from parking car along the street every night. also there was a water pipe going through the corner of the room and when room upstair used the shower, water sound really loud in the room. however, apart from all these defects, the bed was very comfortable, the hotel was good overall and i will stay again just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “First, but not last stay at Buswells.”
Reviews.Author: princephiphi
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a classy hotel with a great staff and central location, then look no further. My DW and I thought that our stay at Buswell's was just grand. Vicky at the front desk could not have been any more attentive and helpful. The staff as a whole were top-notch. The hotel couldn't be in a better location, two blocks from Grafton Street, three from Temple Bar, and across the street from some of the most beautiful government buildings in the city. We will make all our future stays in Dublin at The Buswell's.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! Staff REALLY defines this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMichelle1979
Reviews.Content: I thought Buswells was a great hotel! I disagree with those who question it's price, as it's got a phenomenal location and is quite clean and nice! The staff was wonderful! They were always eager to help us out and give us their input. They were MORE than willing to accommodate us with a check out that was a little bit later than the posted time, due to the time of our later flight. Even with the Saint Patrick's crowd, they never neglected us or brushed our questions off! Upon check out, there was a billing discrepancy that I brought to the attention of the staff, and they were more than willing to investigate and get it straightened out! I can safely say out of all of the hotels I've stayed at that I can remember since I've been a "grown up", Buswells has had BY FAR the absolute BEST customer service! The room was quite nice and comfortable. The bathroom in our room was actually quite modern as well, despite what a previous review said! All in all, we had a lovely experience and if we go to Dublin again, we would have no problem staying at Buswells.

Reviews.Title: “Not great & way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sandraorourkeglynn
Reviews.Content: This was not a bad experience by any means. The hotel is clean, old obviously, but there were a few problems. Funny thing is the bathrooms, completely outdated and not modernized at all, have several negative comments on booking.com. I had the same problem and pointed it out upon checkout, the woman looked at me as if this was the first time she heard this???? ah come on I said you have several comments on the site stating the same problem. Immediately she said yes we do, but the building is old. First she looks surprised and in a half a second she caves??????????????????? The breakfast was extortionatly priced even by Irish standards, as was the bar. Our bar bill for 2 people was the same price as the hotel bill. The service in the same bar was shocking, I had to track down bartenders. They were out of stock, ie cream. No Irish coffee's to be had. We went just down the street to Carluccio's for breakfast, not cheap either but fabulous, certainly better than here. Parking, there is none, well if you check in after 6pm and out before 8am they will comp a nearby multi story parking lot. I checked in at 3pm and out at noon, parking cost me 30 Euro and that was after he took off the overnight charge the hotel would cover. Also there were very drunk guests screaming and laughing in the hall outside my room at 3am. Did management appear? No. Did they apologise when I pointed this out? No. Will I be back. Never.

Reviews.Title: “We considered ourselves lucky we walked out...”
Reviews.Author: Lazarian
Reviews.Content: Tried to have the Carvery Lunch in Buswells Hotel today. When we arrived at the carvery counter at around half one it was deserted. A lady was buzzing in and out of the kitchen through the carvery area and was ignoring us. Several minutes passed no one appeared from the kitchen. Another lady behind was hailed with the same result: no reaction. A nearby small table was crowded with dirty cutlery: a lot in fact! We talked about this later (over a nice enjoyable lunch nearby) and agreed that the Buswell display looked tired, cold, and unappetising. One serving dish was 90% empty and had not been replaced and no sign of heat emanated from the other dishes. The remains of the pork joint was small and the beef large, it looked burnt, and perhaps was not appealing to the diners. Finally Lady Buzz was asked if someone might serve us and she snapped as us that she would deal with the issue when she had a minute. We looked at one another and left the area. At the door I spoke with the gent at reception regarding the matter, but I got the impression since my face was to the exit door, he wasn't interested in what I had to say, or in getting a manager to speak with me. Will we be back? No way whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Georgian style hotel located within walking distance to everything.”
Reviews.Author: doingstuff
Reviews.Content: Great example of Georgian style decor and architecture. Location is perfect for exploring Dublin on foot. Grafton street , Dublin Castle and Trinity College are practically around the corner. The rooms are small and tired. However, the bed is new including duvet style bedding. There is no air conditioning so if you need to open the window in your room it can be quite noisy from the street. Perhaps asking for a back room would correct this. We ate breakfast one morning at the hotel. However, I would recommend eating elsewhere... Better selection and cheaper. We ate at fixx coffee shop and carluccios which are right near the hotel. Also just make sure at check out to review the bill thoroughly. Both bills in the party had issues with being over charged when we had alresdy pre paid. Overall it suited our needs of wanting comfortable accommodation in the heart of Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: FJNM
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, in super location with a very reasonable price tag. It's a little old fashioned but I love it. My only concern was the left luggage seemed somewhat insecure ( I had a bag stolen from another hotel one time when I left my luggage in a similar set up so...once bitten twice shy I guess!!) However the lady at reception assured me that Buswells was the safest hotel in Dublin!! Being across from the Dáil probably helps! Great location, great price..I will stay here next time I'm in the big smoke!

Reviews.Title: “I Love this Place”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: his Place is one of the most welcoming classic hotels I have ever experienced. My room was very cozy and neat. I did not want to leave. The Staff was very friendly and helpful. They (especially Niki) were always happy to answer my questions about Dublin. I hope to stay again this year.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: VinceSaitta Posted by a Volagratis traveler
Reviews.Content: Buswell's has a super location 3 minutes walking from grafton street, close to the very central Dublin, nevertheless is located in a quiet neighborhood, our room was small but comfortable , clean above all, the staff was very friendly and helpful with any requests we did during our staying, think I come back here in my next trip to Dublin

Reviews.Title: “dublin when jetlagged”
Reviews.Author: Antonina S
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Dublin very jetlagged after 30 plus hours of travelling but were feeling a lot better after the friendly welcome we received. Our room was large enough for three people and their luggage and everything was spotlessly clean. Loved the bathroom! The whole ambience of the place was charming and the breakfast was very good too. We used the bar to eat after our arrival and enjoyed the simple fare on offer. The location was ideal for us as we mostly explored Dublin on foot. It was near enough to the airport bus stop for our return to the airport three days later. Staff were helpful and friendly. We would recommend it to future visitors to Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodDuo
Reviews.Content: Nice classic hotel in central Dublin. 2 blocks from Grafton street, Trinity College, and St. Stephens Green. Very affordable. We were given a super early check in which was great! The staff were very friendly. The room wasn't huge but a perfectly good size for a European hotel. The bed was very comfortable as well. The restaurant and bar had a really good set up that is fun to hang out again. The only weird thing is that they make you hand in your key every time you left the hotel, but not a big deal really. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A charming friendly place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: wicklow2012
Reviews.Content: What a great time we had in Buswells,From the moment we arrived till we left we were treated like family nothing was too much trouble,Thanks so much to everyone from the front desk to the great concierieges who could not help us enough,Very special Thanks to Ian in the Bar area though he was working hard and crazy busy he made time for us without any hesitation and we appreciated his attention,Buswells is lucky to have such a hardworking young man,who gives service with a smile a whole new meaning ..,Rooms though small are well stocked and spotless ,Our friends and family that visited were well looked after.. Thank you very much and we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Wales/Ireland weekend”
Reviews.Author: sunlova
Reviews.Content: got here at 8am and by 9am the front desk person took pity on us and found a room for us. Watched the Superbowl in the bar and the night person on duty was really on top of both the front desk and bar duties. Had some laundry done and that went smoothly too. The front desk was always helpful. The bed was comfortable and the shower worked well. Shabby chic is a good adjective for Buswells and am glad they stay up to date with amenities.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the Rugby weekend along with our friends. We found the hotel to be more than accommodating, the staff all but one were very professional. From the cleanliness of the room to the leaving of the luggage on the last day everything was perfect, well when I say perfect - breakfast was slightly disappointing on the Sunday, perhaps a different kitchen brigade who knows, it was not consistent. The more mature waitress was very loud and liked to bang your plate down, she was always in a hurry and pestered you to finish or order, and for some reason did LOT OF MUMBLING as she left our table. Perhaps she just didn’t like us. Never the less don't be put off as Mary on reception more than makes up for her as did the young night porter and the concierge,not forgetting the staff in the lounge bar who serve up a coffee that is equal to Bewleys. Great weekend made even better by the Wales win. If you want the best pint of guiness in Dublin go to Peter's Bar Graffton street, what a treat, with a fantastic welcome.

Reviews.Title: “'City break'”
Reviews.Author: MCE203
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just returned from Dublin after spending the weekend in Buswells Hotel.We always stay at this hotel when in dublin as the location is really good and the staff are excellent -very friendly and accomodating. The food in the restaurant is also very good as we ate there on saturday night.Rooms are spacious and comfortable and very clean.Overall a very good hotel complemented by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “City stay”
Reviews.Author: sinead2380
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, really handy. A few things irritated me though... the hotel went into my credit card a few weeks after I paid the booking deposit, and took the entire amount for the room out of it, which I did not expect to have to pay until the morning after my stay. I also asked the porter to simply put some paper or something to stop the bedroom window from rattling while I was away for the evening, which he said he would, but on return it hadn't been done and therefore I had to stuff the window with tissue paper which didnt work either way. Disappointing but otherwise a nice stay, the breakfast was lovely apart from having to witness an older staff member give out to a younger waitress in front of everyone...poor girl!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TST-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst visiting Dublin for a party. Check-in very helpful and friendly. I had requested a quiet room but found myself at the front of the hotel above the street with single glazing and the heating didn't work. However the night porter helped me move and provided me with a heater - very helpful. New room was pleasant and bed and pillows very comfortable. Still needed the heater though as the main radiator didn't work but it didn't spoil my stay. Rooms beginning to look a bit tired and in need of TLC but very clean nonetheless. The air coach from the airport stops opposite hotel so easy to find but a 4-500yd walk for return stop. Excellent location for shops and attractions all within very easy walking distance. Breakfast was OK and breakfast room very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: DublinCoopers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we were attending a wedding nearby. Check in was good, made even better by being upgraded to a suite. It was quite a trek to our room. Not suitable for someone with reduced mobility. Room was very large with seperate bedroom and living area. Bed was comfy and room was in very good condition. It is a very traditional hotel but that made it quite charming. Breakfast was good. Would stay here again as rate was very good. Great location aswell.

Reviews.Title: “We're glad we chose Buswells”
Reviews.Author: GotaFamilyNow
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying here just after Christmas and were really happy with our choice. The lobby area is BEAUTIFUL and is the perfect place to sit at the fire with a nightcap. Our room was comofortable and all 3 of us slept soundly. There is a very nice bar and the bar food was very nice and reasonably priced. The breakfast next morning was top drawer. If I had to find a fault, the bathroom in our room was cold but surely it is a mark of how nice you feel about a hotel that you can happily overlook a small matter given that everything else was so good. We paid €113, B+B for 2 adults and a child and we consider this a very fair price for our experience in Buswells. In a nutshell- we'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: Andyrock
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night when down in Dublin for christmas party. We recieved a warm and friendly welcome from all the staff, the only issues I had was the rooms are really small (possibly the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in) and because it is quite an old hotel there is alot of noise from rattling pipes etc... In fairness to the hotel there is not much they can do about these items.

Reviews.Title: “Not good vibrations”
Reviews.Author: irishpainter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the 3rd Dec. Late booking and was informed last room available. Booked in about 5.30pm and the bedroom was unbeliveably vibrating from the number of ducts, airconditioning, and god knows what else around. (Not to mention I could hear every trip to the bathroom from the room next door). I didn't complain at the time as I knew Dublin was totally booked out for Christmas parties etc. I paid €115.00 for the 'orchestra' of noise - that is without breakfast. When I mentioned this at reception the next morning the staff were very polite and asked me to complete a complaint report. I don't see why I should fill this out as a verbal complaint should be enough. They deducted the cost of a tea and coffee from my bill and said that the compaint would be reported. I haven't heard anything since. I was told that if I ever wanted to book again, that I should ask for a quiet room. Have you ever asked for a quiet room when booking? staff were

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: POPIEDUBLIN
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for one night, lovely Staff, clean room, the one problem was sorted in less that 5 minutes, the bar food was good for the price and not over priced. The hotel is right in the city center, so it was great for shopping. Great fresh breakfast also. Would stay again and recommend it to anyone who needs a place to lay their head in dear old Dublin Town.

Reviews.Title: “great location, once again”
Reviews.Author: Val R
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Dublin-caught the Air coach & arrived @ Hotel. Very friendly , helpful staff- large room with separate bathroom/bath . Feather duvets & pillows- very comfy & warm. Stayed 7 nights- great orientation to city with Hop a bus- for 2 days- 2nd day free. Was able to visit most of the sites --of which there is alot to see in Dublin- a very vibrant, lively city. Highlights- Trinity college /Book of Kells & Longroom- Christ Church & Dublinia- Dublin castle/Church of the most Holy Trinity & Chester Beatty library-National museum @ Collin Barracks plus National museu of Ireland. Unfortunately National gallery mostly closed for renovation-though very good book shop- National history museum- unfortunately not really into dead stuffed animals. Good eateries- O'Neills - very good value- Elephant & Castle- excellent- Bewleys- Coffee Fixx. Daytrip to Bru na Boinne (Newgrange)- amazing- a must see.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: wrightser
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Buswells recently for a night with a few friends. The hotel is very well located on the corner of Kildare Street and Molesworth Street directly opposite the Dáil. We chose it primarily for its location. It is a good location for access to Dawson Street and the Grafton Street area. The rooms were nice - not plush mind you - and the beds comfortable. The staff were very professional and courteous at all times. Ate in the bar and breakfast at the restaurant and this was fine too. Great place to go to spot politicians, journalists and other political hacks. No complaint about the hotel - would recommend it primarily because of its location. There are better (and more expensive) options nearby but we were happy overall with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel with a Great Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: AmazingRacerWannabe
Reviews.Content: This was a FIND! A friend at work recommended the best location to stay in Dublin. Then I did a search on Trip Advisor limiting the amount I would spend for a hotel for one night for 2 people with breakfast to under 200 USD. This was one, of not too many hotels, that came up for that price. So I booked and I was not the least disappointed. It is great value for the money and probably the most luxurious place I stayed on my 3 week vacation. Now the place is old, but the reception and dining room are grand, just grand. And I am one that appreciates old luxury (coming from the states, you just don't get as much 'old luxury'). I especially like that besides the buffet, you could order a limited variety of things off the menu and I had the salmon and eggs. Probably the best part is that the location really was ideal, bordered by Grafton Street to the West, Trinity College to the north, St. Stephen's Green to the south, and a number of museums to the east. All of these within easy walking distance - 5 minutes. The only criticism I have, and it would be so easy to fix, is there was a letter missing from the hotel sign and some of the light bulbs were burned out of the fixtures. Those things reminded me of the age and that it seemed a little worn. The receptionist was just great. It seemed as if she remembered every person. She knew our room number. This is not a small place for such individualized service.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: rhythmandflow
Reviews.Content: I chose Buswells based only on online reviews, pictures, and rates. I knew nothing about Dublin. When I arrived, I was a little nervous about what I would find. Buswells was the right choice. Great atmosphere in the lobby, lounge and restaurant areas. Excellent service. Clean and nicely decorated room. A great, centrally located neighborhood. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aussietravellers88
Reviews.Content: We travelled around Ireland & used the Hotel on 2 occasions. Found the staff to be very friendly & helpful. The location was great for both sightseeing & shopping. Rooms were of a good size & clean. Found both the accommodation and food to be reasonable priced. Would happliy recommend the Hotel

Reviews.Title: “fantastic staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Gemma M
Reviews.Content: Was worried at first that my 3 year old son wouldn't be welcome as the hotel was bit posh, but the staff were wonderful really friendly and helpful and was soon put at ease. The room a tripple ideal for couple and child plus the hotel is a great location with fab park st stephens green. Great resturants recommended to us by the hotel ("the farm" was amazing and bril for kids). The hotel bar had fantastic atmosphere. Great little cafe busy bee's on the same street as hotel, lovely breakfast very cheap. Can't wait to return!! Only issue room was bit warm and couldn't open the window as it would be too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: una j
Reviews.Content: stayed at Buswells weekend of Dublin marathon 2011 and would like to commend hotel staff on excellent service in particular Patrick and Darius managers on duty during our stay nothing was too much trouble room excellent and hotel location best in Dublin stayed here many times and always good but found staff this stay particularly impressive

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Kevin F
Reviews.Content: A 20 minute journey from the airport on the air-coach with a stop on Kildare street only 2 minutes walk from the hotel . Excellent location for taking in Dublin by foot,plenty to see nearby Trinity College,National Museum,St Stephens Green to name but a few.Breakfast was very good and for 10 euro extremely good value,the staff were friendly and welcoming.The room itself was clean,very spacious and the bed comfortable. We would recommend this hotel to friends and family and would return on our next visit to Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “buswell hotel a gem”
Reviews.Author: Laura E
Reviews.Content: The hotel has everything you wish for: Great location, very very friendly staff, beautiful rooms, quite and peacful place in the heart of Dublin. Stayed there a couple of times and every time it was an excellent excperience! the interior ist outstanding as well. Highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Dublin”
Reviews.Author: Avante65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four days at Buswells Hotel in Dublin last month and what a wonderful find this hotel was. Our quiet room was large with a huge bathroom and had everything you could possibly need to make your stay comfortable. The hotel has a delightful ambiance with a feeling of having stepped back in time - I half expected to see Poirot having coffee in the lounge! As we didn't have breakfast in the hotel I can't comment but evening meals in the bar were very tasty and reasonably priced. The staff were very friendly and attentive, making you feel you were an important guest and I can't praise them highly enough. All in all a delightful hotel which I have recommended to all our friends and we hope to return for another few days of rest and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Find in Dublin”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just completed an eight day stay at Buswells Hotel, Dublin. What a lovely place! We enjoyed the "old world" ambiance, the parlor and bar, the wonderfully friendly & helpful staff. Rooms are small but more than adequate --- provide every amenity. The beds are excellent. Our room was very clean and quiet.The breakfast buffet was substantial. Really everything about our stay was conducive to a very pleasant holiday --- and the Dublin location would be hard to beat as many key sites are in walking distance. We would definietly return to Buswells!

Reviews.Title: “If you want quiet, location,and value...This is your place.”
Reviews.Author: TrapperDan
Reviews.Content: After seven days of driving around the countryside, we finished our stay at Buswells Hotel. The service was great and the room was large and comfortable. A short walk from resturants and clubs. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location is about all Buswells had to offer”
Reviews.Author: Tony_Kenney
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Dublin for the start of our 10 trip thru Ireland and thought it a great place to spend a couple of days before driving thru the countryside. The hotel is very well located on Molesworth street in the heart of Dublin. It is directly adjacent to the Kildare stop on the Aircoach that you can take from the airport which was a main reason we chose this hotel. The lobby is well dressed and the staff of the hotel are a bit aloof. Be careful when booking this hotel if you do so on a trip service like Expedia, as we were put in a smoking twin room and the hotel could not move us. The room is pretty poor for the price that you pay. Maybe that is a symptom of Dublin itself, but we were disappointed. The beds are fairly uncomfortable and the bathroom was pitifully small. How small you ask...the door opens into the bath and then you have to wedge yourself in to get inside. Dirty, moldy and overall not a pleasant shower experience. You'll spend some time trying to get the shower temperature regulated and just when you think you do it starts intermittently going from scalding to freezing. The bar area downstairs did look very nice but we did not get a chance to go as there was so much to do in town in only the two days we were there. I'd pass on this one if you know of another choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambience, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: danish07
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Buswells in September. We asked for and were given, a quiet room. The staff was friendly but a special acknowledgment goes to Paddy who went out of his way to answer our questions and to offer suggestions on things to do and places to see. The hotel is centrally located and within an easy walking distance to the shops and restaurants on Grafton Street. I hope to return to Dublin again in the not too distant future and will definitely plan to make Buswells my Dublin hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: IrdyBirdy
Reviews.Content: If you get tired of the immaculate, comfortable rooms or welcoming reception area but don't want to leave the premises, you can get plenty of daytime entertainment just looking across the street to the daily demonstrations in front of Leinster House. It's a short walk to almost everything, and some of the Air Coach buses stop almost at Buswell's door (be sure to ask the driver at the airport), so wait till the Dublin part of your trip is done before burdening yourself with a rental car. There are several nearby reasonably priced options for breakfast (such as the National Gallery cafe or Peaches on Nassau St.) if you don't spring for breakfast with your room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: flpab
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Dublin on three previous trips. They were all nice places but really noisy. This hotel was more by Trinity and quieter but still in a great location. The room was comfy, had great staff and best part was our room was ready early! Cafes are close by for breakfast and coffee, Grafton St and all the sites also. Our city link bus dropped us off two min from the hotel. We will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mathew M
Reviews.Content: I had a great time there. really enjoyed it. I should mention that the staff was very helpful. Beautiful location, clean rooms. I would definitely recommend Buswells Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Dublin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dickensd
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed Buswells. The hotel is lovely on so many levels. It embodies a true Irish experience. It's warm, inviting and the staff are incredibly personable and helpful. We arrived at 9:30 in the morning on a flight from the States. Paddy (the ultimate concierge) took care of our bags. The front desk called for tea and coffee, which was served in the lobby that felt like the living room of a guest house. They managed to get us in our rooms by 10:30! The area couldn't be more ideal...it's walking distance to museums, Trinity College, Stephan's Green and fabulous restaurants and nightlife. We had actually made reservations for a different hotel on the backend of our trip (for the flight home), but cancelled that hotel so we could return to Buswells. It will always be our favorite Dublin hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Elegant Lobby”
Reviews.Author: texasproud
Reviews.Content: Buswells has a terrific location, close to Trinity College and St Stephen's Green, and a short walk to the major sites in Dublin. It has a very elegant lobby and restaurant area and the staff was very accomodating and friendly. My husband, young adult daughter and I shared a triple room which was adequate but tight. As is common in Europe, the room did not have a thermostat and didn't cool off well at night, even with the windows open although it was 50F outside. It is a very good value and we are likely to stay here again, but not in very hot months.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....An Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: helenl8
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on other tripadvisor reviews and it did not disappoint. Yes...the rooms are small and not appointed like a 5 star hotel, but for the price, location and ambience we loved it. It is so close to major sites including Grafton Street and Trinity College. The lobby is quietly elegant--a fantastic place to sit and have tea. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. Free wifi-- and excellent quality. Loved the little snack of shortbread and coffee, tea, hot chocolate. Lovely place. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.....warm friendly staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: puggielvr
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Buswells for 1 week in August. We had 2 rooms at the hotel, a double and a triple. Our stay at Buswells could not have been better. The staff was wonderful from the time that we walked in the door from our overnight transatlantic flight! My mum was served a lovely cup of tea in the sitting room while I got everyone checked in. Buswells is great value for the money that you pay. Breakfast was included in the rate that we payed. I think that it is nice to start the travel day off with a bit of a meal. The rooms are not fancy but are comfy and clean. Buswells was a perfect base for our Dublin holiday.....a short walk to Grafton Street for shopping and the beautiful Stephens Green around the corner. A quick taxi ride to the train station for our train excursions to Co Cork. The bar area is lots of fun...always bustling with a mix of business associates and vacationers. Cheers to Barbara in the dining room.......she always had terrific ideas for our days activities while she served our yummy breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Murray007
Reviews.Content: I stay in Buswells regularly while on business in Dublin. It is close to Trinity, across the road from the Dail (seat of Government), beside Stephens Green and Grafton Street (the main high end shopping street in Dublin). I love the atmosphere in Buswells. It is old style Dublin. Customers at lunch are a mix of rather excentric locals, politicians including the Prime Minister at times, Irish celebrities (B list usually), TV/News crews and business people. Great for people watching. Food is average to good in the bar. Average in the restaurant. However there are lots of choices for restaurants in the surrounding area. The rooms are comfortable and really good value for its location. It can get noisy sometimes when there is activity around the Dail and the windows are old style sash windows so not great for noise proofing. Its worth putting up with this for the atomosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay and would return.”
Reviews.Author: MM57
Reviews.Content: Our family spent three nights at Buswells and enjoyed our stay. Convenient location, comfortable and quiet rooms, though not spacious, with nice lobby, tea room, bar room and restaurant areas. The breakfast, which we had all three days, was fine. The only issue we had was the initial room we had did not have wifi access, which we had requested and were initially told all rooms had. When we brought this to the hotels attention they quickly changed our room and everything was fine. In general the staff was very courteous and helpful. Overall, Buswells is a very good value and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “In the Midst of Plenty”
Reviews.Author: Doc_Riyadh_SA
Reviews.Content: Located right in the center of everything you would want to see or do in Dublin. Walking "5 min" to "The Green" and the Liffey. Excellent Pubs and restraunts close by. Staff is helpful but not intrusive. Basic, room-- clean, and nice and comfortable with internet -- free code a desk.. Price for location a genuine bargin. There is a reasonable(12 EU) coach service (Viator on line) to and from the airport that drops you off 1/2 block from the front steps of Buswells. We definitely would stay here again and will recommend the Buswell to our good friends. (All of this assumes - that you, like us- do not spend a lot of time in your room. It is a great place to 'lift off' from.)

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: fredpipes
Reviews.Content: Buswell's Hotel is a lovely hotel in a great location - near all the major museums and art galleries. The decor is sumptuous, and the bedding luxurious. The Guinness in the bar was cheaper than in most Dublin bars! Plus I had a comfy seat and wifi. A neat touch was the recycling bin in the room. Unfortunately I had to leave early in the morning, so was unable to rate the breakfast and... it would have got 10/10 except that i couldn't get the hot water working at 7am!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Irish hotel, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: musicbuff04530
Reviews.Content: My stay at Buswells was during June and July, 2011. The rooms were good, the service was lovely, the food in the restaurant was great. Best of all, it was so centrally located to Trinity College, Ireland's museums and shopping. I stayed here for 4 night before departing on a tour and then 2 nights as the tour ended. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “About goods and bads.”
Reviews.Author: OlimpicCarioca
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff is by and large very friendly and helpful, but I'd strongly recommend hotel managers to engage in some constructive criticism with the eldest personnel in charge of breakfast attention (especially a blond, short hair lady, wearing glasses, who rather seem to be running a kindergarten meal facility during WWII in Germany) and bar/lobby services in general (although particularly a quite tall, red hair madam, who behave quite much like a snobbish Briton stereotype-like, commedy character, only that she's real). As a consequence, breakfast, snacks, and drinks end up not being what otherwise could be a charming experience. Decoration at the entrance and hotel lobby, plus bar, are impressive. However, corridors are quite spooky and rooms could use some serious refurbishment. Ramp access from lift to lower rooms on floors is a mandatory requirement the hotel must pay heed to. Front rooms by all means are in need of some serious work on noise cancellation windows. In addition, the absence of a simple a/c device nowadays is simply inexplicable. Bathrooms are poorly decorated and cleaning is definitely an issue to be coped with there. Additional and more quality toiletries might be useful to increase costumer's comfort and, thus, satisfaction. Concierge gentleman during day shift (a genuine, well educated, always-in-a-good-mood Irish man) was an outstanding, useful, kind person. So was the night shift front desk person (a young gentleman from Romania). Location is fantastic! Would be back there, should they agree to adjust their rates to what the hotel indeed offers.

Reviews.Title: “In the center of things”
Reviews.Author: Sean086
Reviews.Content: A well located butique-type hotel in the center of the shopping, theatre & dining area of Dublin. Buswells is a small friendly hotel within walking distance of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Dresdengirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Dublin and absolutely loved Buswells Hotel. The staff was very friendly and super helpful. We arrived early in the morning and they made up a room for us while we went out for breakfast. We had a lovely view of the Museum from our window. The hotel is perfectly situated so that you are not more than a 5-10 minute walk to everything you could want to eat, drink or see in Dublin.... The weather was lovely and we slept with the windows open, it was quiet and we woke to the distant sound of sea gulls and the patter of horse hoves as the open carrigages made their way to St. Stephen's Green in late morning. While we did not eat at the hotel, they cozy lobby is lovely for sitting to read the paper and have a cup of tea. The bar and restaurant are big enough to have a great selection, but small enough to be intimate. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a lovely, relaxing and convenient stay in beautiful Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean,Pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: Kerryman11
Reviews.Content: Top rate location, postage stamp room cramped to the limit when you add a suitcase. Staff was quite pleasant and helpful. Bathrooms were clean but tiny. Bar was great for service, selection, and food. Good price for a Dublin hotel with a European feel. Tough going when trying to reach rooms. Old victorian style has you going up and down stairs in between floors and renders elevator useless. Overall, I would go back again if there were not other options.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, old world hotel, in the city, close to everything, great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: doduley
Reviews.Content: We found Buswells to be as advertised a hotel that caters more to local politicians and journalists. Rooms small but well kept. Staff was great! Hospitable and helpful. I left jewelry in my room Called 2 days later and they were very helpful. Shipped to my home in the states. Even found a hair product I hadn't missed and sent that along! I would definitely stay there again. Breakfast was good as was tea and evening meals.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room we've ever seen, mold in bathroom”
Reviews.Author: NebuCad
Reviews.Content: We only spent a night there but for sure, we would not have stayed there any longer. Overall, the hotel seems very nice but we got this very small room completely at the back of the hotel, which felt like the "leftover" room. The room was OK but very small, no place to put our two suitcases, kinda noisy with a regular window directly over a street. The worst part was the bathroom: there was some sort of sky light and it was covered with mold! I could not believe it. That explained the smell when we got there. The wireless Internet service was also terrible. We were disconnected every 2 minutes, only 1 bar of signal, and it was a voucher based service (annoying). Maybe we were in a dead zone but at least, don't advertise it in the room! If you go there, just don't get rooms 125 and 126.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanantonioscott
Reviews.Content: Buswells is a lovely old hotel just two blocks from Grafton Street and very close to temple bar. The hotel has a very nice Pub with friendly bartenders. We were greeted upon checkin with a smile and warm welcome. We were early (about 11:30am) so were told to leave our luggage in the lobby and our rooms would be ready around 1pm. After lunch we returned and as promised, the rooms were ready and our luggage had been taken to the 3rd floor and put in our room! Great Service! The hotel is located next to the Ireland Senate so their was a major demonstration in the street in front of the hotel with several hundred people holding signs and even a band playing. It was quite exciting rather than annoying. The hotel does not have A/C so you must leave the window open to create a breeze so it doesn't get hot. This worked well for us but when the window is open you do hear the road noise. Great value at this hotel and it is very clean and lovely decorated with period antiques.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Hope-Dutchman
Reviews.Content: Buswells may not be perfect, but it met all of our requirements. It is put together like a puzzle. I almost got lost trying to walk up the back stairway to get to my room. The "3rd" floor has about 4 different levels. Decorations are also a little dated. But we found our triple room to be very spacious (especially for a city center hotel), the beds very comforable, showers warm and powerful, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is very close to the national museum, Trinity, Temple Bar, St. Stephens Green, etc. What else do you really need? Overall we were pleasantly surprised by the value we received from Buswells.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: jannibaby
Reviews.Content: I consider myself a seasoned traveler. I always read reviews of hotels before I book them. I always remember that it is easier to critique than to give praise when I'm reading negative reviews. Dublin was the last stop on a whirlwind tour of Ireland (our 2nd time there). From the reviews, I warned my fellow travelers that this hotel would most likely be on the low end of what we had been used to. I was very wrong. I can honestly say that I don't understand some of the negative reviews of this hotel. I cannot say enough of how pleasantly surprised and enjoyable our stay was. Our room was on the 3rd, our kids room was on the 5th. They were both gorgeous, huge, comfortable, elegant, etc. Yes, the hotel is old, but it is old in a classic way. This is not a Marriott but you can't have those types of buildings in the middle of an old city. The location of this hotel is perfect. The bar, lobby, restaurant area is beautiful. The staff was accomodating. This has to be the best keep secret and value in Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: parkbench28
Reviews.Content: This is not a tourist hotel, and would be perfect for business people. It's a collection of Georgian townhouses, which means the journey to some of the rooms is fascinating- up and down stairs, over bridges, around the back... It was pretty funny. We had a very nice room with a separate living space in a very quiet wing. It was comfortable and very clean. The location makes it perfect- a short walk to anything you would like to visit, with Parliament and the Museum just 30 seconds away. It also has a nice bar/seating area with great sandwiches and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “old world hotel great locaation”
Reviews.Author: Aodh92
Reviews.Content: love buswells great base for shopping , eating out, business Adjacent to all amenities in centre of Dublin Stay there as often as possible

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay at Buswells”
Reviews.Author: redhead8811
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Buswells and could not be more satisfied. The hotel is old and traditional which is what we wanted, but the room was modern and comfortable. We were up the stairs from the lobby but our room was perfectly quiet. The bed was very comfortable with a nice, fluffy down comforter which we needed in June! The bathroom was quite large with a strong shower and plenty of hot water. The location is ideal, a short walk to St. Stephens Green, Trinity College and Grafton Street. Best of all, the price was right. We booked ahead and the rate was very reasonable. There is free Wi-fi but you have to update it daily which is kind of a pain. Overall, we highly recommend Buswells!

Reviews.Title: “Good, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: ImmaBeGoin
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Buswell's for 2 nights. The hotel was very attractive, clean and comfortable but clearly does not cater to tourists. We arrived early (7 am) as we had informed them. I did not expect to be able to check in right away (although I hoped!), but also did not expect the front desk clerk to be brusque and act as if our question was ludicrous. We had been told there was a place to stow our luggage until we could check in; what we didn't know was that the place was right in the lobby. The hotel uses real keys attached to a large key chain that you have to drop off and pick up at the front desk whenever you come and go. There were no instructions regarding temperature control, etc., for those who might be unfamiliar with the radiators, which we found to heat up quite a bit at night, so much that we actually sweltered and slept with the windows open. Also had a bit of a wait for water to come out the bathroom faucet. Overall, the location was excellent for walking to Trinity College, Merrion Square, Grafton Street, St. Stephen's Green, etc. The bed was comfortable, rooms and common areas were clean, housekeeping was outstanding, but the atmosphere was a bit stuffy. We occasionally had to wait at the desk for our key while a staff member was on the telephone. There really wasn't anything bad about the hotel, but there's nothing to rave about. We selected Buswell's because we liked its location and the price was moderate. Higher rated hotels on TA were more expensive. Next time, we'll probably try someplace else

Reviews.Title: “close to city centre, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Moguntia
Reviews.Content: Location: Great location for running in Stephens Green, Shopping in the city centre or sightseeing, you can easily walk for all these purposes just a short stroll. Sponsored parking just round the corner, easy to access and check in /out Hotel: ROOM: Our room was - o.k. it's a city hotel - quite small and dark, has seen better times. Quite loud for directly located at the staircase of the hotel entrance hall and restaurant. FACILITIES: We did not take breakfast or eat/drink in the restaurant so no comment to be made on this. STAFF was friendly, but quite inflexible concerning check out times and left luggage office.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and cozy at the same time & best location for doing family genealogy”
Reviews.Author: celticgypsy
Reviews.Content: Buswells is a classic hotel with gorgeous lobby and bar. Rumor has it that much of Ireland's business is done here over a pint. My room was just a single so it was quite small, but all I needed. It's very centrally located and literally, across the street from the National Library and Archives. It was a tremendous time saver to be so close.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent staff, excellent hotel. Absolute bargain for Dublin.”
Reviews.Author: finbarr_in_z
Reviews.Content: Visited Dublin for the Europa League final (football / soccer) at the Aviva Stadium in May 2011. My girlfriend decided to come along just to see Dublin. She is VERY choosy over hotels - I would have gone in a €30 b&b, so I needed to book something special. Buswells fitted the bill. The location is second to none, with everything easily walkable. 5 minutes to Trinity College (sight seeing), 5 mins to Grafton Street (shopping), 10 mins to Temple Bar (entertainment), 10 mins to O'Connell Street (shopping), 20 minutes to Aviva Stadium . And over the road is the Houses of the Oireachtas (Irish parliament) - with the UK Queen visiting this provided plenty of entertainment & sights! Even if you don't want to go far, the immediate vicinity (St Stephens Green, Merrion Row, Dawson Street) have shops, restaurants & bars to suit all pockets. This is a classy part of town. Getting to the hotel from the airport is easy. The Aircoach (blue bus) was €7 one way or €12 return, & stopped off on nearby Merrion Square North, picking up on the even closer Dawson street, both only a few minutes walk away. I was told a taxi would be €25 one way. The hotel is open 24/7. The front desk staff were efficient, informative & polite. The lobby area is classically elegant, with plenty of space. we were able to leave our luggage behind the front desk on check-out. The rooms were elegant. It was clear that the place had been refurbished recently. Everything was spotless (a major point for my girlfriend). Beds were comfy - not too soft, not too hard - with just the right thickness of duvet for the room temperature. Bathroom very good with an excellent, powerful shower. Plenty of storage space - I always unpack my luggage. Only fault was the TV reception was a little fuzzy on one or two channels (most of the channels are UK ones). Our room was internal to the building, so there was no view, although the room was still bright & airy. Breakfast was excellent, & very filling. We had the Irish breakfast every day. The serve until 10:30am which is good for us later risers. It was also included in the price which seemed rare for Dublin. We used the bar a few times. Prices were equal to anywhere else in the city centre, with a reasonable selection of beers. Excellent Guiness. Many of the clientelle appeared to be from the nearby parliament. We paid €100-€120 per night per room, which seemed 30% cheaper than equivalent hotels in the city. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: dafiland
Reviews.Content: Whether jet lag enhanced my sleep or not, those pillows have to be the best on the planet. Very clean, very compact, very comfy. My room happened to be quite small, but the price was right. The staff experience was varied, with about half the staff completely capable and the other half at various degrees of inexperience. To be expected as the season begins.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, watch out for the price gouging Night Attendant though.”
Reviews.Author: 504travels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a nice stay at Buswells recently. We were traveling through Dublin on our honeymoon. The room was a nice size (comfortable bed, clean linens, nice fluffy comforter) and the bathroom was well appointed (marble counters, nice bath). And the location was nice - we could walk to St. Stephen's Green and to the many shops, restaurants and pubs in the area. My only "issue" with this hotel was the price gouging that the Night Attendant "tried" to get from us. We had booked a reservation for Thursday evening but had arrived in Dublin a day early, on Wednesday. It was about 7:30pm when we arrived and asked if there was any availability - he was told there were three rooms available @ 160 euros. My husband replied that we were booked the next night @ 93 euros and could we get that price, we were told no. So we had to go to another hotel. My problem with that is if you go to their website, there are many last minute specials - there was no way we were paying 160 euro to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Character in St Stephens Green”
Reviews.Author: NanookLondon
Reviews.Content: Buswells is a fantastic hotel which is both comfortable and full of character in a perfect location (I'm sure neighboring hotels cost a great deal more). Dublin is a completely walkable city and perfect for a short break and therefore it's particularly ideal to have a city centre hotel, which doesn't break the bank (and isn't a Premier In/no frills affair). We got a great deal on a room for one night, our room was very large, the bed very comfortable and it came with all the amenities you could want. The staff were friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every respect, delightful attentive sevice.”
Reviews.Author: MakingWaves
Reviews.Content: Just come home from a short stay to celebrate St.Patrick's Day. Buswells Hotel was perfectly located in the centre of Dublin. Although offically a 3 star hotel, I would certainly rate it 4+ star or even a 5. There are many 4 & 5 star hotels worlwide that could learn from Buswells. The staff were simply excellent, very attentive, friendly, efficient and professional. The hotel is very well maintained without the tatty edges and worn out corners which can usually be expected from a hotel of this age. The lounge bar was relaxing and very comfortable and served an excellent pint of Guinness. The restaurant was very nicely appointed and, although there was only one chef on duty that night, they advised us in advance that there would be a 20 minute wait and invited us to relax in the bar for a short while. This was open and considerate; far better than keeping quiet making us sit at the table with a long drawn out wait. The breakfast was simply perfect; a wide choice all freshly prepared and cooked to perfection, and again excellent service. A special mention for Clive and Paddy, two of the best Concierge I have ever had the pleasure to meet. They were totally on the ball making sure everyone was well cared for, and the attention they gave us when looking for particular locations in the City was refreshing and totally genuine. Dublin is certainly a great place; Buswells Hotel makes it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “lovely old georgian building”
Reviews.Author: padsmcginty
Reviews.Content: With having close relatives in Dublin I have always stayed with them on previous trips but this time I wanted to see the city from a tourist point of view rather than as a native Dubliner.Lovely old world atmosphere,atractive comfortable loobby and a pleasant bar which we spent a lot of time in but not nearly enough.Michael the barman was polite ,professional and dilligent.The location is excellent,just across the road from Leinster house with a very short walk to the shops,bars or whatever takes your fancy.If you like minimalism and faceless chain hotels this isnt the place for you but if like me you are visiting a city for its character and history its only right that your accomodation also reflects this,and Buswells does this very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: seawen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in February. The location is fantastic, the lobby and pub/restaurant rooms are amazingly Georgian. The room was very clean but dated and in need of rehab (wallpaper peeling off, grout in tub missing). We needed a room with no feather pillows or duvet and housekeeping was fantastic at switching out for synthetic alternatives. They were very nice about it too. The staff on the front desk and the staff in the dining area were abrupt/brusque- not sure if they were just too busy or didn't care to be friendly. Food was quite good at dinner and breakfast. The hotel was quiet until after midnight. We stayed on a Saturday night and it was clear when everyone was heading back to their rooms after going out. Loud talking in halls, footsteps and doors slamming.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but staff shocking and really rude. worst i have experienced.”
Reviews.Author: jncork
Reviews.Content: stayed here with a friend for two nights, the food is lovely and rooms cosy and very clean. i have never in my life come across staff so rude and unfriendly. the man behind the desk the welcomed us was really nice. we had dinner in the restaurant and the waiter was the most unpleasant person i have ever met. we asked for two glasses of water and he used abusive language under his breath, we were both shocked and appalled. the bar lady in the bar was also very rude, no smile, no manners, and the middle aged maitress was also very unpleasant. the night porter was really helpful and very friendly. the elderly lady behind reception was also very unpleasant. as you can see from my comment, the staff were a major problem. on a positive note, the food was really good and its very central. will i return, yes if the staff would even manage a smile and a thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashion in both sense of the term!”
Reviews.Author: BrauniC
Reviews.Content: Old-fashion is really the best term to qualify this hotel. When I mean old-fashion, I mean it in a very positive but also negative sense. Positive: It is indeed a great charming hotel with the best location ever in Dublin. It has a great Irish atmosphere, ideal if you want a real Irish treat! The staffs are very friendly. The pub of the hotel seems to be quite popular also among shoppers. The hotel is also perfectly located if you want to be in the government district, want to shop or need to do business at Trinity College. Negative: It is however a ‘bit outdated’. The furniture and the bed (small but comfortable) are old. It is part of the charm! The bedroom windows however are very poorly isolated and you can hear everything from the next door room, which is annoying when the next door room is a service room where the cleaning ladies pick up the stuff at 6.00 or 7.00 am. I was also given a smoker room which I never asked for. I had the feeling to sleep in an ashtray. As the hotel was full didn’t bother to ask for another room, but I had to let the window open during the day (in December!!!). In other words, if you look for a hotel full of Irish character, well located for sightseeing and shopping go for it. Otherwise look for something more modern.

Reviews.Title: “3 Greats - location, comfort, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bern56
Reviews.Content: This is a traditional irish decor hotel, very very comfortable and very welcoming. Several sitting areas with comfortable chairs/couches to enjoy tea/coffee in the foyer area. A casual bar meals area has wonderful decor, exposed beams and great meals - very good value, also a formal dining restaurant. Breakfasts are great, plenty of choice. Rooms are spacious, bed very comfortable. The hotels location is great very convenient for the library (searching for family history) and also for the bus stop for hop-on-off bus. We walked to the National Concert Hall for a concert through the beautiful gardens. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great bar - great trip!”
Reviews.Author: bufftibbs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Buswells when I was traveling to Dublin from Denver, CO USA for the U2 concert in July 2009. We spent a few days outside of Dublin, then moved to the Buswells Hotel for the weekend to attend the concert, go shopping, and sight see. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel....the location is WONDERFUL and the staff is friendly. The best surprise of the trip....the bar, located in the lobby, is open to hotel patrons until "last man standing". We were looking for a place to hang out after the concert that was low-key. Our first pick, near Croker, was closed down by 1am. We proceeded back to the hotel and inquired as to closing time. It's also great that it's only open to people staying here. LOVED IT and had a great time that night. The location was great for first-time tourists in Dublin. We could walk EVERYWHERE, and the places we couldn't walk to were acessable by the double decker tour busses...pich practially stopped outside the front door (at St. Stephen's Green). Shopping was wonderful, Temple Bar was close, Trinity College was close...all-in-all a wonderful stay. The room itself was outdated and kind of small. Not that I expected much more from a "historic" hotel in the heart Dublin. This is not the Ritz, as reflected by the prices. For the total cost, I though it was just fine. If/when I return to Dublin, I will stay here again. Thanks for a great trip, Buswells.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: 186605Paul
Reviews.Content: Great location; teriffic staff; well appointed; recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: wrice3
Reviews.Content: This is a nice older hotel that is close to Trinity College and within walking distance of Grafton Street, Temple Bar, etc. Several nice pubs close by. One of the staff was a little surly on occasion, but the staff were generally responsive to any issues with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rickebob
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Ireland. Overall one of the best vacations we've had, thanks in part to our accomodation at Buswells. The hotel is in a great location. Close enough to the action in Temple Bar but still in a relatively quiet area of Dublin. Plenty of attractions and restaurants within a few minutes walk and a major bus stop is just around the corner where you can pick up a DART or a tour bus. Staff was mostly friendly and helpful. There are always excpetions of course but we were made to feel welcome by Ash and Paddy. Thanks for the recommendations guys! Room was good by European standards. Small (like crawling over the bed to get to the other side small) but very neat and clean. Bathroom was spotless and tiny and I managed to flood it the first shower I attempted to take (GREAT water pressure!). I must say our room on the 1st floor was located entirely too close to the hotel bar and we could hear the rowdies well into the night. This was only a problem the first night fortunately and if the bar had been busy every night we would have asked for a room change. We ate breakfast once and it was pretty standard fare. Rather expensive for what you got in my opinon. Had much better luck walking 100 yards to the Busy Bean Cafe for coffee and bagel. Also Le Petite Cafe around the corner also offered a nice breakfast for just a few euro. Buswells bar was a pretty good place to grab a pint or a wee dram. It is Dublin afterall so finding a great pub isn't really difficult at all! All in all we had an enjoyable few nights at Buswells before heading west to Ennis. Buswells was a very good value for us as well, booking well in advance online. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a well located hotel to explore Dublin without breaking the bank. PEACE

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel convenient to all areas.”
Reviews.Author: URnotfromhereRU
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. Staff was friendly and helpful. Bar was good and bar staff were great and engaging. Paddy was most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Maj57
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights in Buswells. This was our second time to stay at this hotel. Bedroom was quite spacious as was the bathroom. Room was to back of hotel - no view at all and there was an industrial fan running up to midnight and started up again in the morning at 6.30 which meant that we couldnt leave the window open because of the constant hum. Getting to the room was an expedition- either through the restaurant and upstairs or up the main staircase and accross a strangly sloping stair/bridge from one building to the next! Breakfast on the first morning was disappointing - cold stewed coffee and the cooked breakfast was only lukewarm. Coffee was changed immediately by the very pleasant waiting staff. On the second morning I asked that the cooked breakfast be hot but when it arrived the plate was hot and the breakfast warm. Overall this did not detract from our stay. All staff were extremely helpful and curteous.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Diane44
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Buswells for 6 nights in May, recommended by Dublin trip advisor forum. Room was more spacious than your usual with a comfy bed, very pleased with the room/bathroom overall. Free wifi in the room, just remember to renew your password at the front desk every 24 hours. Very central and convenient location. Airport shuttle drops you off steps from the hotel. Pick up location for shuttle back to the airport is about a 3 blocks walk. Bar and lounge area relaxed and beautiful. Had one lunch there which was very good. Service was friendly, for the most part, from the front desk to the bar area. Being located right near the government building, politicians tend to frequent, so don't be surprised to see an important figure or two. Really my only complaint was with the homeless man who was in his sleeping bag at night across the road from the front entrance. He woke me up more than once, screaming and talking to himself as early as 5am. More than once he also cursed at me for no reason, only because I was standing in front of the hotel. I was told by hotel staff that they could do nothing, as the owners of the building across the street allowed him to sleep there. Bringing it to their attention, it seemed obvious they were well aware of the situation. It was a shame he was disturbing the peace of this hotel every night I was there. So if you book, as for a room facing the side street, unless you are a heavy sleeper, and prefer not to have fresh air with your windows shut. I would have given this hotel a 5 stars, as on the inside it overall exceeded my expectations for the price, however, the man across the street caused such a disturbance it was difficult to get your full mornings rest, even in their comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “good location but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: a visitor from ireland
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, right in the city centre and a reasonably quiet area. The rooms are tiny, I originally got allocated a single room (smallest room i had seen in a hotel). I could not sleep in such a confined space so I asked for a bigger one which was sorted out straight away (good service). The double room I had was still smaller than average and the bathroom was tiny with no shelf space. I certainly would not like to be sharing it with another adult for a couple of days. Breakfast was tasty and i noticed the staff being very friendly and helpful with the foreign tourists which was a good impression. The parking included in room rate was a good touch. However, there are better hotels nearby and I would not return here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: robo12324
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel!!! I travelled with teenage daughter and our friend. We had a triple room at the side of hotel. The view out the window wasnt good, but staff told us if we are to go again, which we will!!!! to request a room with a view, such as front of hotel, where the main street was. But our room was so quiet and comfy, and staff made us so welcome, that the view didnt matter in the end!!! The street was quiet, as it contained government buildings. Beds very comfortable, bathroom lovely, couldnt fault the room. Hotel staff were just lovely and friendly. Hotel was beautiful, the building and how it was decorated. Its a 5 minute walk to the shops, and few minutes more to the Temple Bar area, where all the pubs and clubs were. A fantastic hotel, I cant wait to go again !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location to visit Dublin. It could however do with a makeover in the TINY bedrooms.”
Reviews.Author: BigJohnDeere
Reviews.Content: It's tired, and the bedrooms, while clean, are dreadfully in need of a major overhaul. The rooms are TINY, claustrophobic, and poorly ventilated. It really puts a new meaning to the saying 'couldnt swing a cat in it'. We were in room 210. On talking to other guests everyone had a similar experience. The rooms were HOT HOT HOT and even putting up with the traffic noise during the night with our room window fully open we still could not get it cooled down enough to get to sleep. Should have asked for a fan I suppose!! Positives.... the staff are amazing people and did everything they possibly could to make our stay enjoyable. The location for visiting central Dublin is great. The free car parking 5-30pm - 9-30am (11-00 on a Sunday) otherwise 3Euro/hr. Theres a good buzz in the bar, foyer, and reception areas. We ate in the Restaurant on the first night and there was only one other couple in the dining room with us. The food was ok, nothing special. We decided to go for the bar snacks menu on our second night. There was a larger selection on offer and we personally enjoyed it more. The breakfasts were up to scratch and there was a good selection on offer for this grade of hotel. To summerise, If the price was lower and it was Winter then possibly I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Ireland - 2 day stay in Dublin”
Reviews.Author: mdk84
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small hotel with and an excellent staff in a great location in Dublin I would highly recommend staying at the Buswells Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: CDSites
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Buswells for 4 nights and we were very satisfied. The location was great, the room was a reasonable size with a comfortable bed, and the bathroom larger than expected. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We chose not to include breakfast with our room fee and did not eat in the restaurant, however we did enjoy drinks in the bar some evenings. Nice, comfortable atmosphere. We took the Air Coach from the airport to get to the hotel and it let us off just across the street. The hotel is just 2 blocks from Grafton Street and just around the corner from Trinity College and St Stephen's Green, and the Tourist Office on Suffolk Street. While this is not a spanking new hotel, we found it to be quite charming and quiet. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: lheuer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May. We arrived at 7:00 AM and were able to check into our room, have breakfast and take a nap. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room was small but spotlessly clean. The beds were very comfortable. We ate dinner in the restaurant and did not like the food very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Fifi05_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location - great for sightseeing, so central to everything. Arrived at lunchtime to book in & my room was ready for me. Girl on reception was very friendly. The room was average size & was a smoking room as I had requested, however the net curtains could have done with a wash. The beds were extremely comfortable. Had dinner that evening in hotel as we were in a hurry - I had chicken strips & chips, my friend had the beef pie - mine was fine, but my friends was just ok. The hotel could do with a little bit of updating and a good spring clean every now and again, but overall I had a very pleasant stay and would return again. We had a room to the back of the hotel and was extremely quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, reasonable, and very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: WalterD99
Reviews.Content: My husband and 13 year-old daughter stayed in Buswells for three nights, and wound up having to stay another two due to the volcanic ash from Iceland that closed down all air travel. They were incredibly accommodating to us, and made us feel a little less stranded. The rooms were spotless and wonderful (coffee/tea and shortbread cookies each morning); the beds absolutely plush; and the pub food in the downstairs restaurant turned out to be not only some of the best we had but also was a good deal. Oh, and the location was perfect! The staff we dealt with were fabulous -- from the bartenders and waiters to the people at the reception desk -- just incredible customer service and care. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely traditional Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AtlanticalMan
Reviews.Content: Spend a night in Buswells in early February and really enjoyed it. The hotel itself is an old fashioned and atmospheric place, with a lovely warm feel to it. I had dinner in their Truman's Restaurant and everything about it was faultless, especially the main course of salmon, which was especially good. Its location, right alongside Government Building and National Museums, and within a few short minutes of the Temple Bar and Grafton Street areas, are ideal for Tourists in particular. I would happily recommend it to anyone and will even more happily return myself when next in Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Great service and good VALUE. But not a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dman7878
Reviews.Content: The only thing that lets this hotel is the rooms. Needs a bit of a room renovation, but overall really good value for money. I really enjoyed my stay! Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel with GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: cunga22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a trip to Dublin compliments of the Quinn group. The entrance & lobby to the hotel is very warm & inviting, with lots of character. The receptionist was very friendly & helpful. Our room was large & spacious, and very comfortable. I would definately stay in this hotel again & would recommend it to family & friends. GREAT LOCATION!

Reviews.Title: “shabby chic more shabby than chic”
Reviews.Author: mojoMidlands
