Reviews.Content: this was our second stay at buswells withiin 2 years .things havent changed the reception area is old world glamour but when you look closely the carpet is stained and the paintwork is chipped the bedrooms are dark and dowdy .the hotel has bags of character and the staff are friendly and helpful.The bar food was poor value and very average .THe breakfast was faultless .While i do not not like the shabby interiors my husband adored the quirkiness and character of the building and the interiors.He detests the souless new hotels that all look the same.The location is great a lick of paint and a freshen up would do wonders for this very special and charming hostelry.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location & Great Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Canadian99
Reviews.Content: Buswells has a very inviting entrance and relaxing atmosphere. Room was clean but dated. Concierge by the name of Paddy was top notch. Overall, hotel was good and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but what is up with those beds?”
Reviews.Author: janice1954tampa
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and in a great spot. Right at Grafton St. and close to everything. The bar was set up nice and able to hold a lot of people. The breakfast was also very good. The beds were small and pretty hard and the pillow flat. No AC and you could keep the window open but don't ask for a street side room. We had 4 rooms and the noise from the cars lasted until late. We also had a homeless sleeping across the st. at a vacant building and he would yell alot or sing during the night. Other than the room at night this place was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, comfortable retreat close to everything important.”
Reviews.Author: Hope4755
Reviews.Content: An old building, well kept up, with polite and helpful staff. The narrow corridors with unexpected steps lent an old-world feel, as did the tasteful decorations. Close by was St. Steven's Green, Trinity College and the fabulous Archaeological Museum (not to be missed!). Almost everything else was within walking distance as well. The cost was surprisingly reasonable for the middle of tourist season. The room was adequate and comfortable and quiet; it was a perfect retreat from the busy, noisy Dublin streets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent only at early bird prices”
Reviews.Author: KepinItReal
Reviews.Content: First of all let me justify the above comment. At the price I paid I would rate this place great value for money. At the full rack rate I would be bitterly disappointed! The room was simple and adequate for our needs. No airconditioning and the room was stuffy. The advertised free wifi is NOT free- its 6 euros for 50 minutes and you have to sign up for it. No fridge in room. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice and cosy bar. Was going to use the restaurant but it was empty so didnt use it- dont like desserted restaurants. The rooms are dated but tidy. I declined a room with breakfast on booking but on arrival this was offered for 10 euros so why not- NO fresh juices (cordial), NO fresh fruit (apart from a fruit salad that was mainly chunks of apple), the muffins were of 'Aldi' quality, no croissants but lots of soda bread. For the 10 euros i was happy as i got a cooked breakfast. Had I paid the full breakfast rate I would have been really fizzed off. So in a nutshell, happy to pay 70 euros a night anda tenner for breakfast. But at 240 euros a night and 17 for breakfast and extra for internet (20 euros for 24 hours) I would have complained bitterly. Recommended ONLY at earlybird rates.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great location and a home from home”
Reviews.Author: daithai
Reviews.Content: Buswells has been operating since 1882 and is an elegant 3 star hotel with special character in the heart of Dublin 2. A charming 67-bedroom Georgian hotel, it is ideally located in the centre of Dublin city a short stroll from St. Stephen’s Green, Trinity College, Grafton Street and many other visitor attractions and near to the DART at Westland Row and the LUAS (Tram) terminal at St. Stephen’s Green. Strangely, whilst I have long recommended it to friends and whilst the present wife and her sister have stayed there this was my first time there as a resident. That is not to say that the place is unknown to me. The bar had Adam style plaster swags painted blue and white and used to be known as the “Wedgwood Bar.” Many years ago in the company of a leading Irish feminist I had bumped into the Northern Ireland poet Michael Longley and his poetess wife Edna who were staying in the hotel. Michael had just won the GPA poetry prize and with the winners cheque in his pocket was in expansive and generous form, from what I could vaguely recall the next day! The bar and restaurant are today called Truman’s after an adjoining print and drawing instrument shop which I was a customer of as a young architectural student. When it closed down in 1975 Buswell’s bought the property and incorporated it into the hotel and as Secretary of the Student Union at Bolton Street I bought most of their stock for our Student Shop. Being across from the Irish Parliament it had an erstwhile reputation as a late night drinking den for politicos leading to the story about a conversation between a policeman who raided the premises at 3 in the morning and encountered the then Minister for Justice (and later Prime Minister) Charles J Haughey “What will it be for you Guard, a pint of Guinness or a transfer to Donegal?” This is a good hotel in a great location, very close to Grafton Street, Trinity College and the National Museums. Our room was spacious with high ceilings and throughout the décor and furnishings were of a good quality and fresh. The Bathroom and shower were excellent if compact. The bar was good with helpful and obliging service but here and in the lounge you could just sit and relax with no pressure to order anything. We only had breakfast on the last morning (when my parents stayed and this is taken in the rather splendidly upholstered Truman’s Restaurant. It was as good as I’ve seen anywhere with a really excellent selection of juices, cereals, breads (including Irish soda bread) meats and cheeses from a buffet counter with the hot Irish Breakfast, toast and generous pots of tea and coffee served at the linen covered table. Last year when my wife and sister in law wanted to stay Buswell’s quoted 245 euros a night. Well this is far too much (you could stay in the Shelbourne for this) but what a difference a year makes as I got the rooms on their site on the internet for 89 to 99 euros a night. Don’t pay extra when booking for breakfast because they price this separately at 20 euros a night (A Mercure Hotel in Paris charges 15 euros!) but we were offered “any breakfast” at the desk at a more reasonable 10 euros. The hotel needs to get its pricing realistic and consistent. The other thing to remember is that as this hotel incorporates four different Georgian buildings so room sizes vary and the dovetailing of bathrooms into the structure doesn’t always make for good sound insulation. Also, being in the centre street noise is unavoidable but we found by closing the windows, including the secondary glazing, the room was quiet. Also as these are Georgian buildings don’t expect aircon, but really you don’t need this in Dublin. This is a well managed property with well trained and friendly staff who really make a difference and I would single out Mary on reception and Clive the Concierge but most of the staff have been here a while and this continuity makes a difference. If you want a personal hotel with a country house athmosphere in a great location Buswell’s is a good deal. Or as the elder Mr C put it as he was reading the complimentary newspaper in his adopted armchair in the relaxing lounge “I could get used to this.”

Reviews.Title: “Cosy homely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dukeno1
Reviews.Content: A little off the beaten track but still within walking distance to temple bar and O'Connell street. Also very near the lovely St Stephens Green. We did get there quite early so our room wasnt ready. When we went back at 2pm it still wasnt but the hotel did provide free tea and coffee while we were waiting and gave us the internet time we had arranged free of charge. The room was lovely and quite roomy, no view to speak off as it was at the back of the hotel but this was probably better as nice and quiet at night time. The bed was comfy and plenty of pilows. Bathroom was nice and light but the shower was apalling, couldn't get any pressure from it and lukewarm even when turned up to the highest. Hubby liked the bath tub though. We didnt eat in the hotel but we may have well had as Dublin was extortinate to eat out and even to drink. We recommend the Duke pub nearby very friendly. Also the Brazen Head which is Irelands oldest pub at Ushers quay. Go any day and an irish band will strike up the music and get the whole pub involved. Went in for one drink and ended up staying for 3. All in all a good stay and did like the hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: pr1nce5582
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend in Dublin for my partners birthday and after trawling the internet for good value, nice hotels we came up with this one. We did have a slight problem in that the weekend we went the Friday was alcohol free. We found this out the day before we got there! Whoops! Because of this alot of restuarants were closed in Dublin as well so we decided to eat in the hotel restuarant.....probably one of the nicest meals we have ever had! The service was second to none, very attentive and always made sure that our water and wine glasses were full. As we were eating they were allowed to serve us wine and this was lovely, our waiter was extremely helpful when it came to picking this. the meal was stunning and fresh and my partner in particular loved his Chocolate Fondant, we were warned when we ordered it that there was a little wait on this as they make it from scratch to order.... why they thought we might be disappointed by this i do not know : ) We booked a double room and we had read that some of the rooms are a little small so when booking i was a bit cheeky and mentioned it was for a birthday weekend and could they ensure that we had a decent sized room. We were not disappointed. They gave us a very large twin room with double beds. It was a little hot at night and we couldnt really open the window as there were air vents outside that were quite noisy. The ladies on reception were extremely helpful and provided us with lots of details of places to go and how to get there etc. The only downside to the experience was that they put a hold on my partners debit card and then when they went to put the authorisation through when we were checking out it wouldnt work - we were nearly late for our plane home and the hotel staff had to let us leave without paying so that we could get home. It took about 4 days before my partner could use his card again. Have to admit though that i dont think it was entirely the hotels fault - think the bank had something to do with it as well!

Reviews.Title: “It is a gem and a bargain to boot”
Reviews.Author: MrMente
Reviews.Content: We booked three triple rooms for three nights at €99 per room per night pre-paid on their site. The rate did not include breakfast. They have rates for including breakfast and/or paying only a deposit (with cancellation option) at extra charge. Two of the rooms were large, one a bit tight. The largest also had a sleep sofa. Bathrooms were large and bright. Beds were comfortable. The hotel is old-style Dublin, full of mahogany and impressive details in the common areas, especially the lobby and sitting rooms. The staff was very helpful and courteous. Grafton Street, Trinity College, St Stephens Green, the National museums are all just 5 to 10 minutes walk. It is a gem and a bargain to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of Ambience”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller73
Reviews.Content: A beautiful old style hotel with friendly staff and a great dining room and pub attached. Down side was that we must have had THE smallest room in the hotel! There was just enough room to get past the foot of the bed. The hotel walls are paper thin too so we could hear the person in the next room snoring. I believe the other rooms in the hotel are better though. Very expensive (at about A$320 a night) for that room. We would stay there again though but would make sure at the time of booking that we had a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: CarolePC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The staff were very helpful and attentive. The hotel was clean, rooms were were comfortable and just what we needed for a weekend stay. Only minor gripe. The showers had curtains and not screens so taking a shower was less pleasurable than it might have been. That said I recommend this hotel. I definitely intend to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCMate
Reviews.Content: A good hotel in a convenient spot! We were really impressed with the level of service we experienced from all the staff! The reception staff were lovely as were the staff in the restaurant both at breakfast and dinner! The food in the bar offers a good choice and is nicely presented. The atmosphere is lively and you feel you are in the centre of everything. We would recommend this hotel and look forward to a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Very close to Grafton Street, Trinity College and the National Museums. The room was spacious with high ceilings. Clean and tidy. Bathroom and shower were excellent. The bar was great, service was wonderful. Had breakfast each morning (included). Good mix of continental and hot breakfast. All staff were very attentive and helpful. Would recommend for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: gesitababy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buswells for five nights and were not very impressed. First, we were put in a tiny double room and, when we asked to change rooms we were told that no other doubles were available for the next three nights. Having no wireless connection and a collapsing ironing board - that needed to be exchanged when we tried to use it- did not help either. Only when we informed them about our intention to change hotels, a bigger and nicer double room was suddenly available, and to their credit, we got complimentary wireless for the rest of our stay. The rooms were nothing special and often not serviced before 3pm. The most disappointing factor, however, was the staff. Each and every member of staff was completely unable to smile and we did not feel welcome at all. Despite the good location we will not be back and we are not able to recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lulu rosie
Reviews.Content: Stayed Saturday night the 12th July. Have stayed in this hotel before. Love it. It would be my first choice in Dublin. Yes, it is a little tired but I would be more inclined to describe it as shabby chic. Staff make the hotel. They couldn't be nicer. Perfect location for Dublin city centre. Rooms are a little small but for all the time you spend in them it doesn't really matter. As for air conditioning - this is Ireland - there isn't much call for it! Great breakfasts and best Irish coffee in Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “Worn and Tired”
Reviews.Author: DonnaE
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent - within 5 minute walk of Stephen's Green and in the opposite direction, 5 min. walk to Temple Bar. (And approx. 15-20 min. walk to St. Patrick's). The front desk staff is friendly and tries to provide good service. The hotel needs some work though. The carpets are worn thin and frayed. There is no A/C in the rooms, and they are very tight, with little room to walk around the bed. There were stains on the furniture and carpets. The bathrooms are small, but new and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but mind the thin walls”
Reviews.Author: HorseyFan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a pleasant 4 night stay at this hotel. The location is excellent and the room was clean and reasonably large. Staff were polite and friendly and the breakfast was fine. However, this is an 'old style' hotel - a converted Georgian building. The room did not have double glazing (they are probably not allowed to fit it) and there was noise from the fairly busy road at the front of the hotel. The walls are very thin - could hear people talking (even yawning) in the adjacent room. Also, pipework behind one wall sounding like fountain whenever the room above flushed their toilet/ used the shower. The bed may be regarded as quite hard by some. However, we did get 4 good nights sleep. Overall, a hotel with lots of plus points but a restful stay may depend on who is in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teritoots
Reviews.Content: Just home from our stay in Dublin and delighted I'd picked the Buswells hotel. The staff were extremely friendly & helpful. The reception staff were extremely well trained and knew their job was to know you. The food was really good and breakfast was fantastic. The room was good size and spacious. My only complaint was the double bed is a standard double bed and it was hard but i like a hard bed. It could of been much comfier though. It would be nice if UK & Ireland caught up and got beds like USA & canada HUGE!! The location is great too very quiet but only 5 min walk to Grafton street and 10 mins to Temple bar area. Overall I really enjoyed my stay at Buswells.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PaulDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Buswells Hotel from a Friday afternoon until the following Monday morning. I found the hotel to be quite nice, a good value for the cost and very close to the heart of Dublin. My room, a single, was small but but comfortable for one person. It included WiFi access, a small television and some nice amenities in the bath. The hotel staff were friendly and accomodating, helping me to order a taxi to the airport when it came time to leave. I can definitely recommend this hotel for visitors to Dublin who want to be within walking distance of Trinity College, Temple Bar and other central attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relaxing break”
Reviews.Author: lhw02
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best location for the city of Dublin. It is right next to the irish parlament building, shops and bars. The food was excellent starting from the irish breakfast to the bar meals and there restaurant food is heaven. The room was on the first floor and very clean and spacious with a lovely ensuite with a good bath and powerful shower. The staff on reception were excellent and Ash in the bar was really polite and charming. We had a wonderful romantic stay in the city and the hotel really made it.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oscar_from_Denmark
Reviews.Content: I spend some time trying to find a hotel in Dublin as close to the city center as possible. There are of course many right in the middle of the action but some of them suffer from noice which is very natural considering their location. But I´m glad I found the Buswells. The location of this hotel is in my opinion excellent as it is in a quiet street but only 3 minutes walk to Grafton Street.. The room wasn´t big but it wasn´t small either. It was very , very clean. We had a room in a quiet part of the hotel but the truth was, that it didn´t seem to be too many guests. People at the lobby were helpful and phoned the Kilmanhaim Gaol to find out for us if they had open that day (Friday in Easter). The breakfast included was tasty too. I booked directly with the hotel through internet and got a quiet good price. All in all: a good hotel in a perfect location if you want to explore the city center. Highly recommended! Best regards! Oscar from Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and graceful”
Reviews.Author: travelscrapper
Reviews.Content: This is an elegant hotel in a great location; minutes from Trinity College, Grafton Street and St. Stephens Green, as well as right next to the National Gallery, National Museum and Leinster House. It’s away from the hustle and bustle of Temple Bar but you don’t feel removed from the action. Upon arriving, we were greeted warmly by the reception staff. They gave us maps, asked us what types of sights we were interested in and showed us to get there. Our room wasn’t ready yet so they watched our luggage while we went to lunch and explored a bit. We had a lovely, quiet room with a extra large bed and plush blankets and pillows. Everything was clean and well cared for and the antique furnishings that decorated our room and the public rooms were charming and graceful. Breakfast was included and served in style. There was the typical European style breakfast: pastries, bread and croissants served with various jams and butter; a selection of smoked hams and cheeses, yogurts and cereals and lots of dried fruits. There was also a menu to order from that included traditional Irish breakfast items. Everything was fresh and kept cold and service was prompt. I would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a quiet, upscale place to relax after pounding the pavement of Dublin all day. There are less expensive places to stay but this hotel had a lot of little extra touches that made it a great place to decompress after sightseeing all day. The lines were soft and thick, the food plentiful and fresh and the staff helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “very mediocre Dublin base”
Reviews.Author: jamieandthemagic
Reviews.Content: First room had constant buzz from kitchens below. 2nd room was tiny & had a very sagy bed. Only when we mentioned that we were staying for 3 days did they make any effort to find something better. ended up having an OK room up in the eaves. New bathroom in our room, but the whole hotel above the ground floor is in dire need of a refurb. its looking very tired. ground floor looks nice & "old hotel" style - dont be deceived by the pictures - the rooms are nothing like the main reception rooms. Breakfast was OK, & staff were OK. Maitre'd was very helpfull. I suppose our rooms saving grace was that we could climb through a small fire access door from our room directly onto a flat roof area, which had some great views. Location was good to tour round Dublin, with some nice local restaurants & bars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: sinbad11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Buswells hotel in the 29th of December for 5 nights,it was Perfect! evreything,just Perfect. the staff was very nice and friendly,the room was very clean and spacious,location is excelent 2 minutes walk from Grafton street ,the airport bus station is around the corner,still very quite at night,breakfast was nice(it was incluiding in the rate)worth waking up for it. we will definitely stay here again whenever we visit Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “Again excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: madbunch
Reviews.Content: Yet again another fantastic weekend! Went as a group of 14 family and friends. I must thank all the staff for making our stay yet again one to remember! each and everyone of you go out of your way to make sure each guest is looked after! If your looking for a hotel thats within walking distance of temple bar, grafton street etc, please book here, not only is the hotel spotlessley clean, does great food and the breakfast is fab, they look after you too!Thankyou all again for a lovely weekend in dublin, hope to be back next year for our third stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: celticstoneman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our stay in Dublin & are planning our next visit.It will be at Buswells! The ambience ,hospitality & professionalism are not to be outdone.Clean comfortable rooms,ours were right above the bar and were not loud at all.Great dining from breakfast to evening.Sharad,in the dining room was a pleasure to meet. Then the incomparable Kathleen on staff made us feel as if we were treasured family. Thank you all & see you soon. Joan and John

Reviews.Title: “Good position; adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shliben
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for 2 nights in mid November, together with 2 friends in another room. The hotel is well positioned but has seen better days. The main reception areas were warm and pleasant and the breakfast was great although the breakfast/dining room was a bit under lit and therefore gloomy. Our twin bedroom was a bit shabby but quite comfortable, but rather cluttered with furniture. The bathroom was large and bright and there was masses of very hot water (10 out of 10 for that). The plastic shower curtain was a real drag when having a shower. The central heating was not working on the first night and then it appeared fine. Our friends first room was very small and they moved to a larger one. Overall the hotel was not a problem and if I could not find anything better I would stay again. Please note that the free car parking in a nearby multistorey, is overnight only and you will be charged for hours outside that. This is noted as a footnote on the confirmation and I missed it!

Reviews.Title: “great location, close to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: Gwyneth006
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located away from the noisier parts of Dublin but within walking distance of all major attractions. The hotel was clean, friendly with a cracking cooked breakfast in the morning. The bar area was cosy and friendly. Visit the Guiness museum, theres more to it than just a great pint of the blackstuff!!!! Flannigans pub near Temple Bar was lively with great live music or crac. The food in Dublin is generally of a high standard but expensive - try traditional fayre, theres lots of it for your money. I would definately stay at this hotel again if visiting Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: europhileAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with husband and 2 friends for 2 nights at the start of our 10 day stay in Ireland. Great rooms -spacious and quiet with no view and great bathroom.Excellent breakfast and staff made our stay very pleasant. Even when we had to wait for our hirecar ( booked for 9 am and still unavailable till 3)they accommodated us and our luggage till the hire car arrived with much charm and grace.Position is excellent for exploring Dublin and in a generally quieter area at night than some other hotels we looked at.

Reviews.Title: “great Location but the rooms are very small”
Reviews.Author: Schlockette
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Buswells for 4 nights for a conference . Great location but the room we had was very small. In fact the first room they showed us was so small that i could not figure out where to put the suticases (2 Normal size bags). We went to another room and it had a ledge for the suitcases, but was not any bigger. Also we were right over the street., so it was noisy--bring your earplugs. So, be aware of this. The room was very clean and the bed was fine. The bathroom is also small. Nice that they had a tea and coffee set up in the room and gave your Walkers shortbread each day. However, the location is great. Walking distance to everything and Dublin is a very walkable city. Breakfast was good--alot of variety and staff was very nice. An added bonus is that they have a small gym on the premises and it is open 24/7. There is not alot of equipment but it is fairly empty so it worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this Charming Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: pattyshea
Reviews.Content: Buswells is a beautiful, old, elegant hotel. It is clean as a whistle and extremely charming. My family stayed here for 3 nights and I wished now that we stayed longer. The employess (especially the front desk) are friendly and were very helpful to us. Service is excellent at this hotel. Breakfast is very good and abundant. Our room was not big but it was clean and comfortable. Dublin is a great city. This is the place to stay while in Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wheezey
Reviews.Content: Went to Dublin with my wife and 14 year old daughter and wanted to stay somewhere with a triple room, away from the stag/hen circuit. After looking at various brochures/reviews I came across the Buswells Hotel and, after searching various booking sites, decided to book direct via the hotel website. I followed this up with an email direct to the hotel and received a most helpful and friendly reply/confirmation from Marie. The Aircoach from outside airport arrivals stops on Kildare Street opposite the hotel where we arrived at approximately 10am. Even though check-in is advertised as much later than that the friendly, helpful staff allowed us to check-in there and then and leave our luggage. We decided to have a quick coffee in the hotel lounge before setting off to see the sights - again the staff were spot on! On returning to the hotel late afternoon the room was ready and what a super triple room it was. It was almost like two separate rooms in one - no foldy-out z-bed or sofa bed but yes, a real third bed. Breakfast next morning was cooked to order and was a great set-up for the day ahead. Again, although we checked out after breakfast, we were able to leave the luggage and enjoy a day in the city until teatime when after another coffee in the hotel we collected the bag and set off for the Aircoach from Dawson Street about 150 yds away. To summarise I would say that the Buswells served us very well, was clean, spacious in the triple room, the breakfast was super and the staff were very friendly indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: karen_newcastle
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to Dublin and chose this hotel as we knew it was in a good location. Situated inbetween Trinity College and St Stephen's Green its ideal for the tourist. The hotel is very impressive when you enter - large reception area and very friendly attentive staff. The bar is also very nice - lots of comfy leathers sofas and chandelliers! We ate breakfast here both mornings and were more than pleased with the service and the food on offer. After such an impressive first impressions I was slightly let down by the tiny room we were given on the 2nd floor over looking the front of the hotel. Althought it was very clean and well appointed and to be honest we hardly spent any time in the room anyway. The only real complaint I would make was that the room was very noisy until the early hours due to the traffic outside and the 'party-goers' passing by. I would definately stay in this hotel again but would ask for a room that didn't face onto the road.

Reviews.Title: “central location but also quiet area”
Reviews.Author: GenJan
Reviews.Content: Buswells is in a very central location just off Grafton Street and within a 5 minute walk from the air-coach stop at Trinity College. The area seems fairly quiet and safe, even during a weekend stopover. This was our third visit to Dublin and our first to this hotel - we came over to see REM Live Rehearsals at the Olympia this time. The hotel is well-run and has friendly, efficient staff. We requested a quiet room anticipating noise from hen/stag-parties etc, but need not have worried in this area. Our room had a huge superking size bed and effective air-con, but no view - just the back of a big office building. Breakfast was lovely - huge choice. We liked the well-run and reasonably priced bar in this hotel. We'll happily stay here on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: turuncworcester
Reviews.Content: Second time here. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice hotel, comfortable and clean. Changed room because wanted a bath - this was done without any bother even though hotel was full.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: WelshFee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Buswells for 2 nights in September 2006. The hotel itself was pleasant and the staff were welcoming. Our room was a complete disappointment - small and dark, with no view, just noise from the hotel kitchen when our window was open. Fortunately we didn't have to spend much time there. The hotel breakfast was good and there was a large selection of hot and cold food. The location was also fine as as the city centre was just a short walk away. We were disappointed with Dublin itself, as compared to many European cities it is visually un-inspiring with lots of drab grey buildings and run down areas. The excellent pubs and restaurants made our short break enjoyable, as did a visit to the Guinness Factory and Kilmainham Gaol but one trip to Dublin was enough for me - I won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “buswells was great!!”
Reviews.Author: saffy85
Reviews.Content: We stayed in dublin for a four night break over the bank holiday weekend. We were on a girly weekend and wanted to be near temple bar but not too near the noise!! The hotel was clean and well presented, the rooms were comfortable with all amenities. The concierge "paddy" was a gem who was only too happy to help (even break into a suitcase that the lock had stuck on!!) and have a laugh in the mean time. The other staff were also helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was enjoyable with a good selection of continental and full cooked irish breakfast which did wonders for a hangover! This hotel was also a five minute walk from plenty of shops. We really enjoyed our stay in dublin and would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “ST. PATRICKS WEEKEND !! PERFECT!!”
Reviews.Author: wassa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day break over St Patricks Weekend!! with my sister and mother, and the hotel made it! Location FANTASTIC!! Can not fault anything, the staff were fantastic they went all out to ensure that our stay was a good one. The room very clean and well kept, everything you need is there, fresh towels bedding etc.. very good breakfast selection included in price, with a very fast and polite service. Also would recommend the hotels own meals they to were fantastic well priced and very tasty. This hotel has it all despite other reviews i can't wait to go again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wincham01
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff, good location, good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “friendly helpful staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pools82
Reviews.Content: Just back from Buswells Hotel. We were a party of 11 ageing juveniles in Dublin for the craic, and Dublin and Buswells delivered. I am always pleasantly surprised when a hotel receptionist welcomes you and confirms that they were expecting you. At Buswells the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly when we arrived, throughout our stay and when we checked out. Everyone, from reception, the dining room, the bar, and the concierge were professional and couldn't do enough to make us feel at home. Some of the rooms were a bit small, but they were very clean and adequate. We all felt the hotel was very good value for money, especially considering how close it is to the centre of town. It was well placed to let you walk easily into the busy areas, yet was in a relatively quiet area itself.

Reviews.Title: “huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: M&KToronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in for a 2 night stay on Dec 29. The problems started from the moment we arrived. There was no doorman to help with luggage, and the elevator wasn't operating. Dragging 4 pieces of luggage up from the curb to the 3rd floor was no treat. The bed was probably quite comfortable when it was new 25 years ago. My back has yet to recover. The linen was rough and itchy. Our wake up calls were not placed and the breakfast we orderd up to our room did not arrive. On the 19 of Dec we stayed at the Brooks Hotel. The service and amenities were far superior. We would gladly stay there again. We will not stay at Buswells again. we would return to Brooks tommorow

Reviews.Title: “Girlie Trip To Dublin”
Reviews.Author: MrsAB
Reviews.Content: I rang the hotel direct and requested a twin bedroom with bath AND shower - which was agreed upon and booked-up. I then noticed it was cheaper to book through the hotel website - I rang the hotel back and queried it but they were not aware of this and said if I booked over the website they could not guarantee me the full bathroom - but to save quite a bit of money I took the chance and again asked for bath/shower on the on-line booking form. I then e-mailed the hotel direct and requested the biggest twin they had available as I had heard the rooms were on the small side (I had read the reviews and thought I was ahead of the game!) On arrival we were shown right to the top of the hotel into the tiniest darkest bedroom with one small window and it stank of cigarettes. Yuk! Apparently I had not requested a no smoking bedroom - I was not asked when I initially booked over the phone and there was nothing on the web to indicate I had a preference! Anyway, they said they were full and they would probably not be able to do anything about it, however, when we mentioned we might have to go and find another hotel, they quickly found us a no smoking room with a nice large window overlooking the front. It was still TINY (hardly anywhere to put all our hard-earned shopping!) and very noisy from early in the morning. I have to say the staff were nice and the breakfast ok. Would probably stay again if we could be guaranteed a bigger room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: anonymous_from_PA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early October for three days. The location is excellent, close to everything. The staff was great, very helpful, and friendly. I agree with the reviewer that stated it really depends on the room you get if it is worth the money. We had room 114 at the top of the stairs on the first floor. The lay-out of the room was very awkward. The size was not really that bad but the furniture layout made it hard to move around the room. The heater was also broken in the room so the mornings were a little chilly. The hotel did provide a space heater. There was also some type of noise in the room which became more of a “white-noise” by the time we left, but it was nuisance. Overall it was not a bad experience but I was hoping for a little more in the room.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: indenver
Reviews.Content: We chose Buswell's because we wanted a central location without a lot of noise, and we were pleased. We walked to most of what we wanted to do, and the bus services stopped within a block for the rest. We put our car in the garage the hotel contracts with, and we felt safe with it there. Our room was large, quiet and comfortable. We ate in the bar one night, and the food, service and prices were what you expect in a hotel bar -- OK. We would stay again next time we are in Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerLSCH
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a lovely stay at the Buswells hotel in Dublin. We are a family of four so they accomodated us with a king size, twin and camp (roll-away) beds. The room was large so we all fit very well. The room was ready when we arrived and all set up for us. The room and bath were very clean. The hotel is nicely located accross from Trinity College and the National Museum. It is very close to Grafton street (2 blocks) with lots of places to eat and drink within a short distance. The staff was incredibley friendly and helpful. The irish breakfasts were delicious. We found the price very reasonable for what we recieved. We highly recommend the Buswell's and hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but a bit stodgy”
Reviews.Author: Metzke
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to use backpacks instead of suitcases on our trip. When we walked into Buswells with our backpacks we found the staff to be extremely rude to us as if we shouldn't be staying there. Not what I was expecting from Irish hospitality! We got put into a room which was next to the staff room which meant that it was noisy throughout the night. The room was big and the bathroom was new and immaculately clean, so even though our welcome wasn't good, the room was comfortable. Dinner at the hotel restaurant was excellent!!! Location is great and it is very easy to walk to all the sites and shopping areas. All up, I probably wouldn't choose to stay there again, but would recommend the hotel for those that are looking for a good 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kingpete
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay, have been to Dublin several times before but this was my first stay at Buswells and I won't be staying anywhere else in future. Great location, really central but away from the noisy Temple Bar area, in fact the only hotel in a fairly quiet Georgian(?) street. Lovely room with huge bed, period furniture and fireplace, impressive public rooms including a large bar area serving a wide range of very good food and an elegant restaurant where breakfast is cooked to order - a rare thing nowadays. All the staff are truly friendly with no hint of the stuffiness one might expect at such a refined hotel. If there is one criticism it is that the room (100) was not air conditioned and the weather was very hot, so it was necessary to open the windows, which allowed in a fair bit of traffic noise - but that's a minor quibble. Overall, it's a very special little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I thoroughly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynn2910
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at Buswells, have stayed in Dublin several times before, this is the best hotel I have stayed in. Central but off the stag/hen trail. Airbus stops right outside on the inward journey and 5 mins walk away on the outward journey, well worth doing, comfortable coaches and 7 euros each way or 12 euros return.About a 1/4 of the taxi fare. Rooms are very clean, hairdryer provided and lots of toiletries in bathroom. Good sized bathroom with very powerful shower. Whole hotel obviously recently renovated. Entrance very impressive, morning room with lots of comfortable sofas, a ready supply of free newspapers, comfortable and spacious bar. Competitively priced bar snacks. The buffet breakfast was spectacular! Irish linen table cloths and napkins, tables well-spaced so no-one is overhearing your conversations! 4 different fresh juices,a selection of fruit, fresh and dried, cereals, croissants and pastries followed by full Irish breakfast all included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have returned today from a three night stay at this hotel, having had a very good time. The hotel is located right next to the Parliament and you feel like you are at the heart of Irish politics. The bar is frequented by some well known Irish individuals. Most of the attractions are within walking distance as is the hop on hop off bus service that will take you to further locations such as the Guiness Storehouse. On the plus side: The reception staff were excellent. They memorised my name and room number and were always pleasant. The food at breakfast and dinner was very good. A very good pint of guiness can be obtained in the Bar. The room had all of the ususal amenities On the negative side The room (121) was rather hot. On the Thursday night, the bar was packed.

Reviews.Title: “Quite satisfied with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: MoCath
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Ireland 2 days ago. Had a 2 night stay at Buswells at the beginning of our trip. We took the Air Coach from the airport to the hotel, (drops you within feet of the hotel) arriving at Buswells around 6:30 a.m. (front doors were still locked) and got let in by the night desk clerk. Originally we had planned on dropping off our luggage and wandering round Dublin for a bit until we could check in. The clerk checked on room openings and told us they did have an open triple room we could check into right then. There might be the possibility of having to move us later in the day but he didn't think so. We were very grateful for being allowed to check in so early as our 11 yr. old son had developed a cold on the trip over and was feeling pretty darn miserable. Our room (302) was on the small size but we weren't bothered by it because we figured it was fair exchange for letting us check in so early. From the little card that had our original booked room number on it, I saw we'd originally been booked for Rm 214. I have no idea if that is a more spacious room. Being able to let my son curl up under some warm covers and get some sleep was more important to me! Desk staff was very friendly. One of the evenings I walked into the crowded bar (business conference?----all in dark suits) and asked the waitress if I could get a bottle of wine opened. She directed me to the restaurant and told me Daniel would be more than happy to do that for me. He did indeed and also gave me 2 wine glasses to take with me, without my asking. Our room was clean, fairly quiet for being right in the city and the bathroom was just fine. Apparently the rate was pretty good too as I told our friend over there what we paid and he said it was pretty good for Dublin esp. given the location. He grew up in Dublin but had never been in Buswells and was quite impressed with the lobby when he came to collect us to take us down to Wexford. Overall we were quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “TOP CLASS HOTEL st paddys day 2006 was made by staying here”
Reviews.Author: PADMIESTA
Reviews.Content: this is one of the nicest hotels that i have ever stayed in. i went here with my girlfriend for st patricks weekend 2006. we stayed for two nights over the weekend and the whole experience of this hotel was magical. if you like a touch of class and you are into thenice things in life then this is the place for you. the hotel foyer says it all, with the sheer style, blazing log fire and the friendly staff, especially paddy. the rooms are very clean and decorated classy, our room had an en-suite bathroom with one of the most powerful showers i have ever experienced. hehehe :-) rooms have satalite tv, coffee and tea with complimentary shortbread biscuits. breakfast is also excellent and very filling as there is so much on offer, the coffee is superb, i have stayed in so many hotels where the coffee is diabolical, not here chaps, A1. the location of this hotel is also A1 it will take you 5 mins if you walk as slow as you can to fetto the hussle and the bussle of grafton street shops. and only 8 mins to get to temple bar. i will end this review by saying that if you stay anywhere in Dublin then make this hotel top of the list. cheers and i hope you enjoy dublin as much as i did. Paddy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel with a touch of class”
Reviews.Author: PebblyBeaches
Reviews.Content: When you walk into this hotel you immediately feel at home. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. As we arrived early our room was not ready but we were able to leave our luggage and come back later. Our room was quite small (cosy) but perfectly adequate for a weekend with a good hospitality tray - the bathroom large. As the whole of the hotel has been renovated everything was clean and fresh. The breakfast was a very relaxing experience in the lovely dining room (Trumans restaurant). The buffet had everything imaginable - fresh fruits, cheeses, meats, breads, preserves, muffins and 3 different juices. You could follow this with a cooked Irish breakfast (highly recommended) or something more simple like poached eggs. The lounge areas have lovely large leather chairs and comfy settees - a very relaxing atmosphere to sit with a morning paper, afternoon tea or a drink before bed. Location is excellent - near to galleries, parks and only 2 minutes walk from Grafton Street. I could not fault this hotel. If you are travelling from the airport catch the local bus which stops next to the Airport Link Bus - it is far cheaper and just as reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Gem of a hotel in a good location. Fabulous food whether it's breakfast or dinner. Great staff. Children welcome & even get their own proper bed. Would be a 4 star hotel if they just paid attention to detail in the rooms. Would definately stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Buswells Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 23-25 Molesworth Street | City Centre - Stephens Green, Dublin, Ireland
